intro: Palafoxia rosea var. ambigua, commonly known as the pink palafoxia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, pink to lavender-colored flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for native gardens.
